events.name: Maker Conference 2017
events.description:
The Maker Conference aims to share best practices in the different aspects of the maker movement.

What are the signals coming out of the Maker Movement that will shape the coming economy, local communities, education, government policy and initiatives? How is the Movement stimulating talent development, opportunity and agency? These are come of the questions that will be discussed in the conference. 

Time: 20th July 2017: 2pm to 5pm, 21st July 2017: 10am to 5pm
Venue Science Centre Singapore
Speakers fee: Free
Attendees Fee: $200 (Includes 2 day admission to Science Centre Singapore, lunch, T-Shirt and one day pass to Maker Faire Singapore on 22nd July 2017)
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, 15 Science Centre Road 609081

events.name: Failure Analysis Seminar
events.description:
Join us at LifeLong Learning Centre @ Paya and learn about Failure Analysis from Mr Wilson Sim, Laboratory Manager of Matcor Technology & Services Pte Ltd. 
 
Click HERE to register by 19th July 2017 .   
Alternatively, please scan the QR code for quick registration.  
For more enquiries, please email Dr May Sim (may_sim@rp.edu.sg) or Ms Wu Jing Yi (wu_jing_yi@rp.edu.sg)
events.location: Lifelong Learning Institute, 11 Eunos Road 8, Singapore 408601

events.name: Silicon Valley and Its Ripples
events.description: IMPORTANT: Please note to register for this event, you must sign up on EventBrite: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/silicon-valley-and-its-ripples-tickets-35851986256  Join us for a spirited discussion on trends in AI and Automation in Silicon Valley, and the ripple effects felt in the rest of the world. Also, what are the new innovation hubs emerging in the world and what is their impact on Silicon Valley. Our excellent panel consists of  Christopher Schroeder, Dr. Noah Raford and Steve Leonard and will be moderated by Ayesha Khanna. Christopher M. Schroeder is an American entrepreneur, advisor and investor in interactive technologies and social communications. He co-founded HealthCentral.com, one of the nation's largest social and content platforms in health and wellness sold to Remedy Health in 2012. Steve Leonard is Founding CEO of SGInnovate and a technology-industry leader with a wide range of experiences, having played key roles in building several global technology companies. Dr. Noah Raford is the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of the Dubai Future Foundation and a former advisor on futures, foresight, and innovation in the UAE Prime Minister’s Office. Ayesha Khanna is CEO of ADDO AI, an artificial intelligence advisory and incubator headquartered in Singapore.

events.name: Fireside chat with Hon Cheng and JJ about Elk and Apple Design Awards
events.description: Venue:  Singapore Power, 8th Floor, Keppel Towers 2 240 Tanjong Pagar Rd, Singapore - 088540 Details: TBD Speakers:  Hon Cheng and Junjie won the very 1st Apple Design Awards (ADA) for Singapore and Southeast Asia for their app Elk.  Hon Cheng makes things happen, and makes them really fast, and he obsesses himself with animation. He made some of the most popular apps in Singapore—SG Buses and SG NextBus. Junjie pays attention to how things work, how fast and how easy a user can do something. His own app and foray into app development—Due—was featured on Daring Fireball. ​After many sessions of badminton and bubble tea, they founded Clean Shaven Apps in June 2012. Together, they have launched six apps. Their most recent app, Elk, won an Apple Design Award in 2017.
events.location: Singapore Power, 240 Tanjong Pagar, Keppel Towers 2, Level 08

events.name: Kubernetes On Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
Please confirm RSVP here: goo.gl/forms/fftCOOfGLgYls5PS2 


Hello All. I am excited to announce the meetup for July. 

There are two talks scheduled : 

1. Hunter Nield will discuss Storage and Stateful Apps on Kubernetes 2. Zumata will discuss their experiences running Kubernetes on GKE.  Storage and Stateful Apps in Kubernetes by Hunter Nield. “Can I run a Database in Kubernetes?” - the most frequently asked question after learning the basics of Kubernetes is how to store data for Stateful Applications.  This talk will introduce concepts around Volumes and the various storage back-ends available.  We will wrap up the talk with a demonstration on how to run a typical Database backed application.  


Zumata experiences running on GKE by Zumata.  Zumata will present a simple walk through on bringing up a cluster on GKE with Zumata's experiences on pitfalls & what not to do to avoid them. The presentation will include creating pods & the different components of Kubernetes and showcase the capabilities GKE has to offer.
events.location: Google Singapore, 70 Pasir Panjang Rd, Singapore 117371

events.name: TensorFlow and Deep Learning: 6th Event : Tips & Tricks
events.description: After spending the last 2 meetups going into text and language this coming month we are going broader in topic and looking at some of the tricks of the trade in Deep Learning, TensorFlow and Keras You can expect to have 2-3 'long format' talks, which discuss tips, short cuts, and tricks for building, training and improving your models. We also have a sister event this month with our PyTorch Meetup. It is aimed a little more at the advanced end of Deep Learning talks. So if you are deep into Deep Learning then its probably worth you checking out.  And, as always, we're actively looking for more speakers - both '30 minutes long-form', and lightning talks where we welcome folks to come up and talk about something cool they've done with TensorFlow and/or Deep Learning for 5-10mins (if you have slides, then #max=10). The key for the Lightning Talks slot is simply the cool/interesting factor.  It doesn't matter whether you're an expert or and enthusiastic beginner: Given the responses we have had, we're sure there are lots of people who would be interested to hear what you've been playing with. Please suggest yourself here : https://www.meetup.com/TensorFlow-and-Deep-Learning-Singapore/suggestion/ We've put the MeetUp start time at 6:45pm, so that we can start the talks promptly at 7pm.
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, , Singapore

events.name: An Evening with MakerTour: Growing the Global Maker Movement
events.description:
Come spend an evening with Marie Levrault and Lucas Graffan from MakerTour who are mid-way on their trip to document makerspaces in Asia. At this stage of their journey, they have documented more than 20 labs in India, Thailand and Vietnam.

In this evening of design & ideation, we'll be spending time exploring the question: 

What systems and infrastructure are needed to support the growth of the maker movement as a a truly globally distributed community?

We'll be looking at issues of trust, values, economic transactions and collaboration among others. MakerTour will also be discussing this topic during FAB13 in Santiago de Chile. Powerful insights from this session could be shared at this global event. 

Light refreshments will be provided. This session is brought to you by the Community Lab@UWCSEA, powered by Sustainable Living Lab.
events.location: Sustainable Living Lab (SL2), 1 Tampines Street 73, Singapore 528704

events.name: ArtScience Late: Lalu Lalang Lab
events.description:
ArtScience Late: Lalu Lalang Laboratory
Thursday, 20 July 2017 | 7.15pm & 8.45pm
Level 4, Inspiration Gallery 
Free on a first-come-first-served basis. Limited capacity.

In Charting the Multiverse of Our Dreams, performance collective Lalu Lalang Laboratory (L3) explores ideas of genesis, cosmological cycles and alternative futures, interweaving personal journeys that are entwined with their artistic practices. Impromptu play and extemporaneous divertissement play out in a dialogue of poetry and science, through vignettes of sound, dance and projection. 

A multitude of focal points all coming together at once, this new synergy of ideas and energies will manifest in a provocative experiment. You are invited to participate by making playful decisions as consumers of the arts.

About Lalu Lalang Laboratory (L3):
L3 started meeting in the spring of 2016 to exchange, encounter, seek, investigate and question the journey of creative existence. The lab marks the rigour, commitment and curiosities of four established artists –Aaron Khek (choreographer/dancer), Leslie Tan (cellist), Nirmala Seshadri (multidisciplinary artist/choreographer) and Ix Wong Thien Pau (choreographer/dancer). Their attitude and approach towards art making is borderless, sans hierarchies and labels. 

L3 is open to all like-minded artists. They sit, have tea, and jam. For this jaunt, L3 is joined by guest collaborators Mervin Wong, Swedha Rajaram and Gavin Yap.

Lalu Lalang Laboratory #ArtScienceLate
